t: Hosea 1
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Hosea son of Beeri during the reigns of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and of Jeroboam son of Jehoash, king of Israel.
Hosea’s Marriage and Children

When*p the Lord*s first spoke to Hosea, he said this to him: Go*pn and marry a woman of promiscuity, and*ln have children of promiscuity, for*ln the land is committing blatant acts of promiscuity by*ln abandoning the Lord.*s
So*p he went and married Gomer daughter of Diblaim, and she conceived and bore him a son.
Then the Lord*s said to him: Name*pn him Jezreel, for in a little while I*ln will bring the bloodshed of Jezreel on*ln the house of Jehu and*ln put an end to the kingdom of the house of Israel.
On*ln that day I will break the bow of Israel in*ln Jezreel Valley.

She*p conceived again and gave birth to a daughter, and the Lord*s said to him: Name*pn her Lo-ruhamah, for*ln I will no longer have compassion on*ln the house of Israel. I*ln will certainly take them away.
But*ln I will have compassion on the house of Judah, and*ln I will deliver them by the Lord*s their God. I*ln will not deliver them by bow, sword, or war, or*ln by horses and cavalry.
After*p Gomer had weaned Lo-ruhamah, she conceived and gave birth to a son.
Then the Lord*s said: Name*pn him Lo-ammi, for*ln you are not my people, and*ln I will not be your God.

Yet*ln the number of the Israelites will*ln be like the sand of the sea, which*ln cannot be measured or counted. And*ln in the place where they were told: You*ln are not my people, they*ln will be called: Sons of the living God.
And*ln the Judeans and the Israelites will*ln be gathered together. They*ln will appoint for themselves a single ruler and*ln go up from the land. For*ln the day of Jezreel will be great.
Hosea 2
Call*pn your brothers: My People and*ln your sisters: Compassion.
Israel’s Adultery Rebuked
Rebuke*pn your mother; rebuke her. For*ln she is not my wife and I am not her husband. Let*ln her remove the promiscuous look from her face and*ln her adultery from between her breasts.
Otherwise,*ln I will strip her naked and*ln expose her as she was on the day of her birth. I*ln will make her like a desert and*ln like a parched land, and*ln I will let her die of thirst.
I*ln will have no compassion on her children because*ln they are the children of promiscuity.

Yes,*ln their mother is promiscuous; she*ln conceived them and acted shamefully. For*ln she thought, “I will follow my lovers, the*ln men who give me my food and water, my*ln wool and flax, my oil and drink.”
Therefore,*ln this is what I will do: I*ln will block her way with thorns; I*ln will enclose her with a wall, so*ln that she cannot find her paths.

She*ln will pursue her lovers but not catch them; she*ln will look for them but not find them. Then*ln she will think, “I*ln will go back to my former husband, for*ln then it was better for me than now.”
She*ln does not recognize that*ln it is I who gave her the grain, the*ln new wine, and the fresh oil. I*ln lavished silver and gold on her, which*ln they used for Baal.
Therefore,*ln I will take back my grain in its time and*ln my new wine in its season; I*ln will take away my wool and linen, which*ln were to cover her nakedness.
Now*ln I will expose her shame in*ln the sight of her lovers, and*ln no one will rescue her from my power.
I*ln will put an end to all her celebrations: her*ln feasts, New Moons, and Sabbaths — all*ln her festivals.
I*ln will devastate her vines and fig trees. She*ln thinks that these are her wages that*ln her lovers have given her. I*ln will turn them into a thicket, and*ln the wild animals will eat them.

And*ln I will punish her for the days of the Baals, to*ln which she burned incense. She*ln put on her rings and her jewelry and*ln followed her lovers, but*ln she forgot me. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
Israel’s Adultery Forgiven
Therefore,*pn I am going to persuade her, lead*ln her to the wilderness, and*ln speak tenderly to her.

There*ln I will give her vineyards back to her and*ln make the Valley of Achor into*ln a gateway of hope. There*ln she will respond as she did in*ln the days of her youth, as*ln in the day she came out of the land of Egypt.
In*ln that day — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — you*pn will call me “my husband” and*ln no longer call me “my Baal.”
For*ln I will remove the names of the Baals from*ln her mouth; they*ln will no longer be remembered by their names.

On*ln that day I will make a covenant for them with*ln the wild animals, the birds of the sky, and*ln the creatures that crawl on the ground. I*ln will shatter bow, sword, and*ln weapons of war in the land and*ln will enable the people to rest securely.
I*ln will take you to be my wife forever. I*ln will take you to be my wife in righteousness, justice,*ln love, and compassion.
I*ln will take you to be my wife in faithfulness, and*ln you will know the Lord.*s
On*ln that day I will respond— this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration. I*pn will respond to the sky, and*ln it will respond to the earth.
The*ln earth will respond to the grain, the*ln new wine, and the fresh oil, and*ln they will respond to Jezreel.
I*ln will sow her in the land for myself, and*ln I will have compassion on*ln Lo-ruhamah; I*ln will say to Lo-ammi: You*ln are my people, and*ln he will say, “You are my God.”
Hosea 3
Waiting for Restoration

Then*p the Lord*s said to me, “Go again; show love to a woman who is loved by another man and is an adulteress, just as the Lord*s loves the Israelites though they turn to other gods and love raisin cakes.”
So*p I bought her for fifteen shekels of silver and nine bushels of barley.
I said to her, “You are to live with me many days. You must not be promiscuous or belong to any man, and I will act the same way toward you.”
For*p the Israelites must live many days without king or prince, without sacrifice or sacred pillar, and without ephod or household idols.
Afterward, the people of Israel will return and seek the Lord*s their God and David their king. They will come with awe to the Lord*s and to his goodness in the last days.
Hosea 4
God’s Case against Israel
Hear*pn the word of the Lord,*s people of Israel, for*ln the Lord*s has a case against*ln the inhabitants of the land: There*ln is no truth, no faithful love, and*ln no knowledge of God in the land!
Cursing,*ln lying, murder, stealing, and*ln adultery are rampant; one*ln act of bloodshed follows another.
For*ln this reason the land mourns, and*ln everyone who lives in it languishes, along*ln with the wild animals and the birds of the sky; even*ln the fish of the sea disappear.
But*ln let no one dispute; let no one argue, for*ln my case is against you priests.
You*ln will stumble by day; the*ln prophet will also stumble with you by night. And*ln I will destroy your mother.

My*ln people are destroyed for lack of knowledge. Because*ln you have rejected knowledge, I*ln will reject you from serving as my priest. Since*ln you have forgotten the law of your God, I*ln will also forget your sons.
The*pn more they multiplied, the*ln more they sinned against me. I*ln will change their honor into disgrace.
They*ln feed on the sin of my people; they*ln have an appetite for their iniquity.
The*ln same judgment will happen to*ln both people and priests. I*ln will punish them for their ways and*ln repay them for their deeds.
They*ln will eat but not be satisfied; they*ln will be promiscuous but not multiply. For*ln they have abandoned their devotion to the Lord.*s
Promiscuity,*ln wine, and new wine take*ln away one’s understanding.
My*pn people consult their wooden idols, and*ln their divining rods inform them. For*ln a spirit of promiscuity leads them astray; they*ln act promiscuously in*ln disobedience to their God.

They*ln sacrifice on the mountaintops, and*ln they burn offerings on the hills, and*ln under oaks, poplars, and terebinths, because*ln their shade is pleasant. And*ln so your daughters act promiscuously and*ln your daughters-in-law commit adultery.

I*ln will not punish your daughters when*ln they act promiscuously or*ln your daughters-in-law when*ln they commit adultery, for*ln the men themselves go off with prostitutes and*ln make sacrifices with cult prostitutes. People*ln without discernment are doomed.
Warnings for Israel and Judah
Israel,*pn if you act promiscuously, don’t*ln let Judah become guilty! Do*ln not go to Gilgal or*ln make a pilgrimage to Beth-aven, and*ln do not swear an oath: As the Lord*s lives!
For*ln Israel is as obstinate as a stubborn cow. Can*ln the Lord*s now shepherd them like*ln a lamb in an open meadow?
Ephraim*ln is attached to idols; leave*ln him alone!
When*ln their drinking is over, they*ln turn to promiscuity. Israel’s*ln leaders fervently love disgrace.
A*ln wind with its wings will carry them off, and*ln they will be ashamed of their sacrifices.
Hosea 5
Hear*pn this, priests! Pay*ln attention, house of Israel! Listen,*ln royal house! For*ln the judgment applies to you because*ln you have been a snare at Mizpah and*ln a net spread out on Tabor.
Rebels*ln are deeply involved in slaughter; I*ln will be a punishment for all of them.
I*ln know Ephraim, and*ln Israel is not hidden from me. For*ln now, Ephraim, you*ln have acted promiscuously; Israel*ln is defiled.
Their*ln actions do not allow them to*ln return to their God, for*ln a spirit of promiscuity is among them, and*ln they do not know the Lord.*s
Israel’s*ln arrogance testifies against them. Both*ln Israel and Ephraim stumble because*ln of their iniquity; even*ln Judah will stumble with them.
They*ln go with their flocks and herds to*ln seek the Lord*s but*ln do not find him; he*ln has withdrawn from them.
They*ln betrayed the Lord;*s indeed,*ln they gave birth to illegitimate children. Now*ln the New Moon will devour them along*ln with their fields.
Blow*pn the ram’s horn in Gibeah, the*ln trumpet in Ramah; raise*ln the war cry in Beth-aven: Look*ln behind you, Benjamin!
Ephraim*ln will become a desolation on*ln the day of punishment; I*ln announce what is certain among*ln the tribes of Israel.
The*ln princes of Judah are like those who*ln move boundary markers; I*ln will pour out my fury on them like water.
Ephraim*ln is oppressed, crushed in judgment, for*ln he is determined to follow what is worthless.
So*ln I am like rot to Ephraim and*ln like decay to the house of Judah.
When*ln Ephraim saw his sickness and*ln Judah his wound, Ephraim*ln went to Assyria and*ln sent a delegation to the great king. But*ln he cannot cure you or heal your wound.
For*ln I am like a lion to Ephraim and*ln like a young lion to the house of Judah. Yes,*ln I will tear them to pieces and depart. I*ln will carry them off, and*ln no one can rescue them.
I*ln will depart and return to my place until*ln they recognize their guilt and seek my face; they*ln will search for me in their distress.
Hosea 6
A Call to Repentance
Come,*pn let’s return to the Lord.*s For*ln he has torn us, and*ln he will heal us; he*ln has wounded us, and*ln he will bind up our wounds.
He*ln will revive us after two days, and*ln on the third day he will raise us up so*ln we can live in his presence.
Let’s*ln strive to know the Lord.*s His*ln appearance is as sure as the dawn. He*ln will come to us like the rain, like*ln the spring showers that water the land.
The Lord’s First Lament
What*pn am I going to do with you, Ephraim? What*ln am I going to do with you, Judah? Your*ln love is like the morning mist and*ln like the early dew that vanishes.
This*ln is why I have used the prophets to*ln cut them down; I*ln have killed them with the words from my mouth. My*ln judgment strikes like lightning.
For*ln I desire faithful love and not sacrifice, the*ln knowledge of God rather than burnt offerings.
But*pn they, like Adam, have violated the covenant; there*ln they have betrayed me.
Gilead*pn is a city of evildoers, tracked*ln with bloody footprints.
Like*ln raiders who wait in ambush for someone, a*ln band of priests murders on the road to Shechem. They*ln commit atrocities.
I*ln have seen something horrible in the house of Israel: Ephraim’s*ln promiscuity is there; Israel is defiled.
A*pn harvest is also appointed for you, Judah. When*ln I restore the fortunes of my people,
Hosea 7
when*pn I heal Israel, the*ln iniquity of Ephraim and the crimes of Samaria will*ln be exposed. For*ln they practice fraud; a*ln thief breaks in; a*ln raiding party pillages outside.
But*ln they never consider that I remember all their evil. Now*ln their actions are all around them; they*ln are right in front of my face.
Israel’s Corruption
They*pn please the king with their evil, the*ln princes with their lies.
All*pn of them commit adultery; they*ln are like an oven heated by a baker who*ln stops stirring the fire from*ln the kneading of the dough until it is leavened.
On*ln the day of our king, the*ln princes are sick with the heat of wine— there*ln is a conspiracy with traitors.
For*ln they - their hearts like an oven — draw*ln him into their oven. Their*ln anger smolders all night; in*ln the morning it blazes like a flaming fire.
All*pn of them are as hot as an oven, and*ln they consume their rulers. All*ln their kings fall; not*ln one of them calls on me.
Ephraim*ln has allowed himself to get mixed up with the nations. Ephraim*ln is unturned bread baked on a griddle.
Foreigners*ln consume his strength, but*ln he does not notice. Even*ln his hair is streaked with gray, but*ln he does not notice.
Israel’s*ln arrogance testifies against them, yet*ln they do not return to the Lord*s their God, and*ln for all this, they do not seek him.
So*pn Ephraim has become like a silly, senseless dove; they*ln call to Egypt, and they go to Assyria.
As*ln they are going, I will spread my net over them; I*ln will bring them down like birds of the sky. I*ln will discipline them in accordance with*ln the news that reaches their assembly.
The Lord’s Second Lament
Woe*pn to them, for they fled from me; destruction*ln to them, for they rebelled against me! Though*ln I want to redeem them, they*ln speak lies against me.
They*ln do not cry to me from their hearts; rather,*ln they wail on their beds. They*ln slash themselves for grain and new wine; they*ln turn away from me.
I*ln trained and strengthened their arms, but*ln they plot evil against me.

They*ln turn, but not to what is above; they*ln are like a faulty bow. Their*ln leaders will fall by the sword because*ln of their insolent tongue. They*ln will be ridiculed for this in the land of Egypt.
Hosea 8
Israel’s False Hopes
Put*pn the ram’s horn to your mouth! One*ln like an eagle comes against*ln the house of the Lord,*s because*ln they transgress my covenant and*ln rebel against my law.
Israel*ln cries out to me, “My*ln God, we know you!”
Israel*ln has rejected what is good; an*ln enemy will pursue him.

They*pn have installed kings, but*ln not through me. They*ln have appointed leaders, but*ln without my approval. They*ln make their silver and gold into*ln idols for themselves for*ln their own destruction.
Your*ln calf-idol is rejected, Samaria. My*ln anger burns against them. How*ln long will they be incapable of innocence?
For*ln this thing is from Israel — a*ln craftsman made it, and it is not God. The*ln calf of Samaria will be smashed to bits!
Indeed,*pn they sow the wind and*ln reap the whirlwind. There*ln is no standing grain; what*ln sprouts fails to yield flour. Even*ln if they did, foreigners*ln would swallow it up.
Israel*ln is swallowed up! Now*ln they are among the nations like*ln discarded pottery.
For*ln they have gone up to Assyria like*ln a wild donkey going off on its own. Ephraim*ln has paid for love.
Even*ln though they hire lovers among the nations, I*ln will now round them up, and*ln they will begin to decrease in number under*ln the burden of the king and leaders.
When*ln Ephraim multiplied his altars for sin, they*ln became his altars for sinning.
Though*ln I were to write out for him ten*ln thousand points of my instruction, they*ln would be regarded as something strange.
Though*ln they offer sacrificial gifts and*ln eat the flesh, the*ln Lord*s does not accept them. Now*ln he will remember their guilt and*ln punish their sins; they*ln will return to Egypt.
Israel*ln has forgotten his Maker and built palaces; Judah*ln has also multiplied fortified cities. I*ln will send fire on their cities, and*ln it will consume their citadels.
Hosea 9
The Coming Exile
Israel,*pn do not rejoice jubilantly as the nations do, for*ln you have acted promiscuously, leaving your God. You*ln love the wages of a prostitute on*ln every grain-threshing floor.
Threshing*ln floor and wine vat will not sustain them, and*ln the new wine will fail them.
They*ln will not stay in the land of the Lord.*s Instead,*ln Ephraim will return to Egypt, and*ln they will eat unclean food in Assyria.

They*ln will not pour out their*ln wine offerings to the Lord,*s and*ln their sacrifices will not please him. Their*ln food will be like the bread of mourners; all*ln who eat it become defiled. For*ln their bread will be for their appetites alone; it*ln will not enter the house of the Lord.*s
What*ln will you do on a festival day, on*ln the day of the Lord’s*s feast?
For*ln even if they flee from devastation, Egypt*ln will gather them, and Memphis will bury them. Thistles*ln will take possession of their precious silver; thorns*ln will invade their tents.

The*ln days of punishment have come; the*ln days of retribution have come. Let*ln Israel recognize it! The*ln prophet is a fool, and*ln the inspired man is insane, because*ln of the magnitude of*ln your iniquity and hostility.
Ephraim’s*ln watchman is with my God. Yet*ln the prophet encounters a bird trap on*ln all his pathways. Hostility*ln is in the house of his God!
They*ln have deeply corrupted themselves as*ln in the days of Gibeah. He*ln will remember their iniquity; he*ln will punish their sins.
Ephraim Bereaved of Offspring

I*pn discovered Israel like*ln grapes in the wilderness. I*ln saw your ancestors like*ln the first fruit of the fig tree in its first season. But*ln they went to Baal-peor, consecrated*ln themselves to Shame, and*ln became abhorrent, like*ln the thing they loved.
Ephraim’s*ln glory will fly away like a bird: no*ln birth, no pregnancy, no conception.
Even*ln if they raise children, I*ln will bereave them of each one. Yes,*ln woe to them when I depart from them!
I*ln have seen Ephraim like Tyre, planted*ln in a meadow, so*ln Ephraim will bring out his children to*ln the executioner.
Give*ln them, Lord—*s What*ln should you give? Give*ln them a womb that miscarries and*ln breasts that are dry!

All*pn their evil appears at Gilgal, for*ln there I began to hate them. I*ln will drive them from my house because*ln of their evil, wicked actions. I*ln will no longer love them; all*ln their leaders are rebellious.
Ephraim*ln is struck down; their*ln roots are withered; they*ln cannot bear fruit. Even*ln if they bear children, I*ln will kill the precious offspring of their wombs.
My*ln God will reject them because*ln they have not listened to him; they*ln will become wanderers among the nations.
Hosea 10
The Vine and the Calf

Israel*pn is a lush vine; it*ln yields fruit for itself. The*ln more his fruit increased, the*ln more he increased the altars. The*ln better his land produced, the*ln better they made the sacred pillars.
Their*ln hearts are devious; now*ln they must bear their guilt. The*ln Lord*s will break down their altars and*ln demolish their sacred pillars.
In*ln fact, they are now saying, “We*ln have no king! For*ln we do not fear the Lord.*s What*ln can a king do for us?”
They*ln speak mere words, taking*ln false oaths while making covenants. So*ln lawsuits break out like*ln poisonous weeds in the furrows of a field.

The*pn residents of Samaria will have anxiety over*ln the calf of Beth-aven. Indeed,*ln its idolatrous priests rejoiced over it; the*ln people will mourn over it, over*ln its glory. It*ln will certainly go into exile.
The*ln calf itself will be taken to Assyria as*ln an offering to the great king. Ephraim*ln will experience shame; Israel*ln will be ashamed of its counsel.
Samaria’s*ln king will disappear like*ln foam on the surface of the water.

The*ln high places of Aven, the sin of Israel, will*ln be destroyed; thorns*ln and thistles will grow over their altars. They*ln will say to the mountains, “Cover us!” and*ln to the hills, “Fall on us!”
Israel’s Defeat because of Sin
Israel,*pn you have sinned since*ln the days of Gibeah; they*ln have taken their stand there. Will*ln not war against the unjust overtake*ln them in Gibeah?
I*ln will discipline them at my discretion; nations*ln will be gathered against them to*ln put them in bondage for*ln their double iniquity.
Ephraim*pn is a well-trained calf that*ln loves to thresh, but*ln I will place a yoke on her fine neck. I*ln will harness Ephraim; Judah*ln will plow; Jacob*ln will do the final plowing.
Sow*ln righteousness for yourselves and*ln reap faithful love; break*ln up your unplowed ground. It*ln is time to seek the Lord*s until*ln he comes and sends righteousness on*ln you like the rain.
You*pn have plowed wickedness and reaped injustice; you*ln have eaten the fruit of lies. Because*ln you have trusted in your own way and*ln in your large number of soldiers,

the*ln roar of battle will rise against your people, and*ln all your fortifications will be demolished in*ln a day of war, like*ln Shalman’s destruction of Beth-arbel. Mothers*ln will be dashed to pieces along*ln with their children.
So*ln it will be done to you, Bethel, because*ln of your extreme evil. At*ln dawn the king of Israel will be totally destroyed.
Hosea 11
The Lord’s Love for Israel
When*pn Israel was a child, I loved him, and*ln out of Egypt I called my son.
Israel*ln called to the Egyptians even*ln as Israel was leaving them. They*ln kept sacrificing to the Baals and*ln burning offerings to idols.
It*ln was I who taught Ephraim to walk, taking*ln them by the hand, but*ln they never knew that I healed them.
I*ln led them with human cords, with*ln ropes of love. To*ln them I was like one who*ln eases the yoke from their jaws; I*ln bent down to give them food.
Israel*ln will not return to the land of Egypt and*ln Assyria will be his king, because*ln they refused to repent.
A*ln sword will whirl through his cities; it*ln will destroy and devour the bars of his gates, because*ln of their schemes.
My*ln people are bent on turning from me. Though*ln they call to him on high, he*ln will not exalt them at all.

How*pn can I give you up, Ephraim? How*ln can I surrender you, Israel? How*ln can I make you like Admah? How*ln can I treat you like Zeboiim? I*ln have had a change of heart; my*ln compassion is stirred!
I*ln will not vent the full fury of my anger; I*ln will not turn back to destroy Ephraim. For*ln I am God and not man, the*ln Holy One among you; I*ln will not come in rage.
They*ln will follow the Lord;*s he*ln will roar like a lion. When*ln he roars, his*ln children will come trembling from the west.
They*ln will be roused like birds from Egypt and*ln like doves from the land of Assyria. Then*ln I will settle them in their homes. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
Ephraim*pn surrounds me with lies, the*ln house of Israel, with deceit. Judah*ln still wanders with God and*ln is faithful to the holy ones.
Hosea 12
God’s Case against Jacob’s Heirs
Ephraim*pn chases the wind and*ln pursues the east wind. He*ln continually multiplies lies and violence. He*ln makes a covenant with Assyria, and*ln olive oil is carried to Egypt.
The*pn Lord*s also has a dispute with Judah. He*ln is about to punish Jacob according to his conduct; he*ln will repay him based on his actions.
In*ln the womb he grasped his brother’s heel, and*ln as an adult he wrestled with God.
Jacob*ln struggled with the angel and prevailed; he*ln wept and sought his favor. He*ln found him at Bethel, and*ln there he spoke with him.
The*ln Lord*s is the God of Armies; the*ln Lord*s is his name.
But*ln you must return to your God. Maintain*ln love and justice, and*ln always put your hope in God.
A*pn merchant loves to extort with*ln dishonest scales in his hands.
But*ln Ephraim thinks, “How*ln rich I have become; I*ln made it all myself. In*ln all my earnings, no*ln one can find any iniquity in me that*ln I can be punished for!”
Judgment on Apostate Israel
I*pn have been the Lord*s your God ever*ln since the land of Egypt. I*ln will make you live in tents again, as*ln in the festival days.
I*ln will speak through the prophets and*ln grant many visions; I*ln will give parables through the prophets.
Since*ln Gilead is full of evil, they*ln will certainly come to nothing. They*ln sacrifice bulls in Gilgal; even*ln their altars will be like piles of rocks on*ln the furrows of a field.
Further Indictment of Jacob’s Heirs
Jacob*pn fled to the territory of Aram. Israel*ln worked to earn a wife; he*ln tended flocks for a wife.
The*ln Lord*s brought Israel from Egypt by a prophet, and*ln Israel was tended by a prophet.
Ephraim*pn has provoked bitter anger, so*ln his Lord will leave his bloodguilt on him and*ln repay him for his contempt.
Hosea 13
When*pn Ephraim spoke, there was trembling; he*ln was exalted in Israel. But*ln he incurred guilt through Baal and died.

Now*pn they continue to sin and*ln make themselves a cast image, idols*ln skillfully made from their silver, all*ln of them the work of craftsmen. People*ln say about them, “Let*ln the men who sacrifice kiss the calves.”
Therefore,*ln they will be like the morning mist, like*ln the early dew that vanishes, like*ln chaff blown from a threshing floor, or*ln like smoke from a window.
Death and Resurrection
I*pn have been the Lord*s your God ever*ln since the land of Egypt; you*ln know no God but me, and*ln no Savior exists besides me.
I*ln knew you in the wilderness, in*ln the land of drought.
When*ln they had pasture, they*ln became satisfied; they*ln were satisfied, and*ln their hearts became proud. Therefore*ln they forgot me.
So*ln I will be like a lion to them; I*ln will lurk like a leopard on the path.
I*ln will attack them like*ln a bear robbed of her cubs and*ln tear open the rib cage over their hearts. I*ln will devour them there like a lioness, like*ln a wild beast that would rip them open.
I*ln will destroy you, Israel; you*ln have no help but me.
Where*pn now is your king, that*ln he may save you in all your cities, and*ln the rulers you demanded, saying, “Give*ln me a king and leaders”?
I*ln give you a king in my anger and*ln take away a king in my wrath.
Ephraim’s*ln guilt is preserved; his*ln sin is stored up.
Labor*ln pains come on him. He*ln is not a wise son; when*ln the time comes, he*ln will not be born.
I*pn will ransom them from the power of Sheol. I*ln will redeem them from death. Death,*ln where are your barbs? Sheol,*ln where is your sting? Compassion*ln is hidden from my eyes.
The Coming Judgment

Although*pn he flourishes among his brothers, an*ln east wind will come, a*ln wind from the Lord*s rising up from the desert. His*ln water source will fail, and*ln his spring will run dry. The*ln wind will plunder the treasury of*ln every precious item.
Samaria*pn will bear her guilt because*ln she has rebelled against her God. They*ln will fall by the sword; their*ln children will be dashed to pieces, and*ln their pregnant women ripped open.
Hosea 14
A Plea to Repent
Israel,*pn return to the Lord*s your God, for*ln you have stumbled in your iniquity.
Take*ln words of repentance with you and*ln return to the Lord.*s Say*ln to him, “Forgive all our iniquity and*ln accept what is good, so*ln that we may repay you with*ln praise from our lips.
Assyria*ln will not save us, we*ln will not ride on horses, and*ln we will no longer proclaim, ‘Our gods! ’ to*ln the work of our hands. For*ln the fatherless receives compassion in you.”
A Promise of Restoration
I*pn will heal their apostasy; I*ln will freely love them, for*ln my anger will have turned from him.
